import { useState } from 'react';
import './App.css';

function App() {
  const [background, setBackground] = useState('');

  // Two predefined background images
  const images = [
    'data:image/jpeg;base64,',
    'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/v2/D4D03AQGXRCvAUGbN5g/profile-displayphoto-shrink_400_400/profile-displayphoto-shrink_400_400/0/1703744704368?e=2147483647&v=beta&t=QL3M-kjBmFKFhGdp6XO9ipcuSx44kajBTh4I5v2uO7w',
  ];

  return (
    <div
    className="w-full h-screen transition-all duration-200"
    style={{
      backgroundImage: background ? `url(${background})` : 'none',
      backgroundSize: 'contain', // Ensures image fits the screen
      backgroundPosition: 'center',
      backgroundRepeat: 'no-repeat', // Prevents image from repeating
    }}
  >
      <div className="fixed flex flex-wrap justify-center bottom-12 inset-x-0 px-2">
        <div className="flex flex-wrap justify-center gap-3 shadow-lg bg-white px-3 py-2 rounded-3xl">
          
          <button
            onClick={() => setBackground(images[0])}
            className="outline-none px-4 py-1 rounded-full text-black shadow-lg transition-all duration-200"
            aria-label="Set background to Image 1"
          >
            Image 1
          </button>

          <button
            onClick={() => setBackground(images[1])}
            className="outline-none px-4 py-1 rounded-full text-black shadow-lg transition-all duration-200"
            aria-label="Set background to Image 2"
          >
            Image 2
          </button>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
}

export default App;
